commit.title: Merge pull request #116 from zachwaugh/master
Fixes property for TUIAccessibilityElement
Merge pull request #112 from ncuesta/patch-1
Screen_Scale doesn't exist anymore
Update README.md
Merge pull request #109 from jwilling/master
__unsafe_unretained, newlines.
Transition TUIAccessibilityElement to ARC.
Merge pull request #107 from github/dev
added more missing unsafe_unretained annotations
mark the ivar as being unsafe_unretained too
nil out our layer's delegate when we're dealloc'd
don't try to do autocorrection that's outside the string's range
don't use link-time optimizations since they crash the unit test runner
don't let us pass nil strings into -[NSAttributedString initWithString:]
added TUIPopover
block asserts in the release build
Merge branch 'dev' of github.com:github/twui into dev
just use NSWindowDidChangeScreenProfileNotification
Fix subview ordering when inserting subviews rather than simply adding them.
added TUITableViewStyleGrouped
ARC requires 64-bit ABI
more ARC fixes
Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master' into dev
method name changed
use NSWindowDidChangeBackingPropertiesNotification to watch for scale changes
update the layer's scale when the screen changes
-[CALayer contentsScale] is 10.7+
-[NSWindow backingScaleFactor] is 10.7+ so guard our uses of it
Merge branch 'dev' of github.com:github/twui into dev
real HiDPI support
Don't lighten buttons if they are of custom button type.
Merge branch 'dev' of github.com:github/twui into dev
Change how we calculate height for a group of text. Previous to this changes, we would unecessarily add height when the frame contained multiple lines of text.
Merge branch 'dev' of github.com:github/twui into dev
fixed a potential underflow
Merge pull request #2 from github/plug-tuitextview-leak
Merge pull request #1 from github/plug-tuitextrenderer-leak
Plug leaks when right-clicking in an editable text view
Plug a leak in -[TUITextRenderer sizeConstrainedToWidth:numberOfLines:]
support shift-click selection in TUITextRenderer
send non-consumed -performKeyAction:'s as -performKeyEquivalents if the next responder is an NSViewController
use needsDisplayWhenWindowsKeyednessChanges to signal that we need redrawn
added needsDisplayWhenWindowsKeyednessChanges to TUIView
handle key equivalents that should be captured by the input context
Merge branch 'dev' of github.com:github/twui into dev
adjust the selection when replace a word so that it never lies outside the string's bounds
Add line break mode support to TUILabel.
make Xcode 4.3 happier
fixed TUITextView so that it now works with more advanced input methods like Chinese and Japanese
don't synthesize `flashing` since we implement it ourselves
Merge branch 'dev' of github.com:github/twui into dev
forward mouse events to the input manager, may be necessary to support different input methods
enumerate the words taking into account the user's locale

Don't re-layout the scroll view at the same time the animation finishes. Due to it sitting in the runloop this allows the opacity to be set to 1.0 for a fraction of a second. So instead we take jump in slightly early. Looks good, bit of a hack though.
Change the scrollbar flash animation to match up more with iOS. Still a slight visual glitch at the end of the animation.
support flashing the scroll bars even if the scroll bars are hidden
nil out the NSView when it's dealloc'd
always nil out the unsafe nsView pointer
don't reuse the wholeLineRange since it might have changed
release the nsView in dealloc, not right after we create it
give the window a shadow
send the scroll event up the responder chain if we're not going to handle it
don't release our hosting NSView
allow TUINSWindows to become key
don't log missing bindings anymore
continue looking for a selectable index path until we find one
fixed a bug where the spelling correction would try to correct a word if you were editing it
extract the selection drawing into its own method for easier customization and subclassing
make sure we end our tooltip if we're being removed from the view hierarchy
set the frame using the accessor so that it reset the CTFrame
added a method for adding the standard Cut / Copy / Paste items to a menu
add the standard text menu items to the text view's contextual menu
fixed the positioning of the accent character popup
don't bother saving and restoring the old path and frame
implemented some more key bindings
call through to super like a nice little class
Merge pull request #81 from jspahrsummers/SnowLeopardCompatibility
added a method for getting a string's size when constrained to a set number of lines
make sure the header view knows that it should be layed out again
keep NSViewControllers in the responder chain
stubs for some needed key-binding implementations
allocate all the line origin arrays in the heap instead of the stack
also do auto replacement corrections
send rootView -removeFromSuperview
clear out the text renders after getting rid of the subviews
remove the tooltip when our window loses its keyness
fixed the top content inset
release the temp text renderer
it's not weak anymore
retain the temp text renderer
whoops, don't use 10.7-only api
fixed the positioning of the dictionary popup
make sure the old index path sticks around until the method's done
add the rootView's layer before the view moves to a new window instead of after
xcode lolz
fixed some bugs with arrowing through the text in a text view
nil out the renderer's first responder since the view's going away
arrow up and down now work in non-single line text views
fudge the cursor rect and height for newlines
implement -sizeThatFits:
remove the underline before we do the actual replace since the length might change
expose TUITextEditor
only forward -performKeyEquivalent: if we're the first responder
-moveDown: shouldn't tab to next
just call through to the rootView
call super instead of just returning NO
just call through to super
up and down arrows move to the beginning and end of the line in single line mode
only return YES from -performKeyEquivalent: if the selector isn't -noop:
send -performKeyEquivalent: to the first responder too
probably don't need quite *that* many cached index paths
added an accessor for decelerating
reset the frame at each call to build the frame
actually render the placeholder text
mouse down should always set it as the first responder
sometimes the layer's frame gets screwed up after being removed from the window, so make sure it's reset before it gets added back
Qualify some weak references called out in comments that I missed
Migrate sample project to ARC
Analyze sample project after every build
Make sample project refer to the framework target, instead of including the source wholesale
Remove -[NSArray tui_map:], which is no longer used (and we have blocks now, if we want to do it properly)
Depend on NSGraphicsContext to retain/release image contexts -- don't confuse the memory management by doing it ourselves
Remove deprecated TUIFont methods
Use __unsafe_unretained instead of __weak, for compatibility with 10.6
ARC migration, baby.
Refactor how TUIView handles subviews, for better memory management practices and ARC compatibility
Refactor -[TUIImage innerShadowWithOffset:radius:color:backgroundColor:] and -[TUIImage embossMaskWithOffset:] to not assign to 'self'
Rename TUICGImageFromBitmapContext() to TUICreateCGImageFromBitmapContext() and change memory management semantics to be compatible with ARC, refactoring callers to match
Fix ARC precheck warnings in TUIFastIndexPath (in part by removing memory management methods from the singleton implementation)
Fix ARC precheck warnings in TUITextRenderer
Fix ARC precheck warnings in TUIKit functions
Fix ARC precheck warnings in TUIImage
Fix ARC precheck warnings in TUIAttributedString
Fix ARC precheck warnings in CoreText additions
Fix ARC precheck warnings in TUIFont
Fix ARC precheck warnings in TUIColor

Import TUINSWindow.h for use in TUITableViewCell.m
Import TUINSWindow.h for use in TUIControl.m
Import TUIImage.h for use in TUIButton+Content.m
Remove obsolete build setting for Fix and Continue
Enable LTO for Release builds
Analyze after every build
Migrate as many target settings up to the project level as possible
centralized the line rect caching
only get the line bounds after we know we want that line
don't try to add a nil associated view
cache line rects since they're so fucking expensive to calculate
always update the selection, regardless of whether the index path is the same
don't need to set the selection twice
corrected the height calculation for CTFrame
actually call the window movement methods when window movement happens
default the background color to clear
draw the background color for buttons
merged in from upstream
specify whether we want to be made first responder
a non-deprecated method to set the view's opaqueness
